info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 20 at 1:44AM MST until January 20 at 8:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation , including freezing rain, expected. A light glaze of ice accumulation is possible. * WHERE...Hill County and Northern Blaine County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Sidewalks and other exposed surfaces may accumulate a light glaze of ice.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
